title: Add Example test functions for godoc documentation
description:
## Context
Go's Example* test functions serve double duty: they appear in godoc as runnable examples AND they're compiled and executed by go test, ensuring documentation never drifts from reality. Currently there are zero Example functions in the codebase.

## What to Do
- Add Example functions for the most common API operations:
  - ExampleNewClient - creating a client with options
  - ExampleOrganizationService_List - listing resources
  - ExampleOrganizationService_Get - getting a single resource
  - ExampleOrganizationService_Create - creating a resource
  - ExampleWorkspaceService_List - nested resource listing (org -> workspace)
- Place in appropriate *_test.go files (external test package: terrakube_test)
- Each example should use httptest.NewServer to be self-contained and runnable

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] At least 5 Example functions covering core CRUD patterns
- [ ] All examples compile and pass via `go test`
- [ ] Examples appear correctly in `go doc` output
- [ ] Examples demonstrate the most common usage patterns a new consumer would need
- [ ] Examples use the external test package (terrakube_test) for realistic import paths

## Notes
- Examples are the #1 thing new users look for when evaluating a Go library
- go test already runs Example functions, so this adds compile-time verification for free
- The Output: comment at the end of each example is optional but recommended for verification
- Start with the happy path; error handling examples can come later

## Reference
- https://go.dev/blog/examples
- https://pkg.go.dev/testing#hdr-Examples
close_reason: Created example_test.go with 5 Example functions for godoc: ExampleNewClient, ExampleOrganizationService_List, ExampleOrganizationService_Get, ExampleOrganizationService_Create, ExampleWorkspaceService_List. All pass.

title: Add gorelease for API breaking change detection
description:
## Context
As an open source client library, consumers depend on our public API surface. There's currently no automated way to detect if a PR introduces a breaking change (removed/renamed exported types, changed function signatures, etc.). gorelease compares the current code against the latest tagged release and reports incompatible changes.

## What to Do
- Add a CI job that runs `gorelease` to diff the API surface against the last release tag
- Install via `go install golang.org/x/exp/cmd/gorelease@latest`
- Should warn (not necessarily fail) on breaking changes, or fail if on a minor/patch version bump

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CI runs gorelease on PRs
- [ ] Reports any breaking API changes (added/removed/changed exported symbols)
- [ ] Output is visible in PR checks
- [ ] Does not block PRs outright (advisory initially), can be made blocking later

## Implementation Notes
```yaml
- name: Check API compatibility
  run: |
    go install golang.org/x/exp/cmd/gorelease@latest
    gorelease || true  # advisory mode, don't fail yet
```

## Considerations
- Requires at least one tagged release to compare against (we have tags from release.yml)
- Can be made strict (fail on breaking changes) once semver discipline is established
- gorelease output clearly lists: compatible changes, breaking changes, and suggested version bump

## Reference
- https://pkg.go.dev/golang.org/x/exp/cmd/gorelease
- Used by many Go standard library and official tooling repos
close_reason: Closed

title: Add atomic operations (/operations) support
description: The OpenAPI spec v2.27.0 defines a POST /operations endpoint for JSON:API atomic operations (ext='https://jsonapi.org/ext/atomic'). This is NOT a standard CRUD resource -- it uses a batch operation pattern with 'add', 'update', 'remove' ops against multiple resource types in a single request. The Go client currently has no support for this. This would require a new service that uses requestRaw/doRaw with the atomic operations content type and a custom request/response model. Endpoints: POST /api/v1/operations. Operations: add, update, remove. Each op includes a ref (type, id, lid, relationship, href) and data payload.
close_reason: Implemented atomic operations service with Submit method, types, and tests

title: Add coverage threshold gate to CI
description:
## Context
Coverage is uploaded to Codecov on main pushes but PRs are not gated on coverage. A contributor could merge a PR that drops coverage from 96.6% to 50% with no CI failure. Need a minimum threshold to prevent merging PRs that skip tests.

## What to Do
Option A (Codecov): Add a `.codecov.yml` with project/patch coverage targets
Option B (Go native): Add a step that parses coverage.out and fails if below threshold
Option A is preferred since we already use Codecov.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] PRs that decrease coverage below threshold fail CI
- [ ] Threshold set to a reasonable floor (e.g., 85% project, 80% patch)
- [ ] Coverage check runs on PRs, not just main pushes
- [ ] Codecov status check appears on PRs

## Implementation Details (Option A)
Create `.codecov.yml`:
```yaml
coverage:
  status:
    project:
      default:
        target: 85%
    patch:
      default:
        target: 80%
```

Also need to update ci.yml to upload coverage on PRs too (currently only on push to main).

## Current State
- 96.6% statement coverage (86.9% including testutil package)
- Coverage only uploaded on push to main, not on PRs
- No Codecov config file exists
close_reason: Closed

title: Add govulncheck to CI
description:
## Context
govulncheck scans Go dependencies for known CVEs in the Go vulnerability database. Currently we have no vulnerability scanning. This is especially important for an open source library where consumers inherit our dependency tree.

## What to Do
- Add a new CI job (or step) that runs `govulncheck ./...`
- Install via `go install golang.org/x/vuln/cmd/govulncheck@latest`
- Should fail the build if any known vulnerabilities are found in dependencies

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] New `security` or `vulncheck` job in ci.yml
- [ ] Runs `govulncheck ./...` against the codebase
- [ ] Build fails if vulnerabilities are detected
- [ ] Currently passes (google/jsonapi v1.0.0 has no known vulns as of now)

## Reference
- https://pkg.go.dev/golang.org/x/vuln/cmd/govulncheck
- Go team's official vulnerability scanner
- Zero config needed, just run it
close_reason: Closed

title: Add go mod tidy check to CI
description:
## Context
There's no CI check ensuring go.mod and go.sum stay clean. A contributor could commit with stale module files (added a dependency but didn't run go mod tidy, or removed usage but left the require). This causes confusing issues for downstream consumers.

## What to Do
- Add a CI step that runs `go mod tidy` then checks for uncommitted changes
- Should fail if go.mod or go.sum would change after tidy

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CI runs `go mod tidy` and verifies no diff in go.mod/go.sum
- [ ] Fails the build if module files are not tidy
- [ ] Currently passes (modules are clean)

## Implementation
Add to lint job or as a separate job:
```yaml
- name: Check go.mod tidy
  run: |
    go mod tidy
    git diff --exit-code go.mod go.sum
```

## Notes
- Simple, effective, and catches a common class of errors
- Many Go OSS projects include this as a standard check
close_reason: Closed

title: Add explicit go vet step to CI
description:
## Context
govet is enabled in golangci-lint config, but running standalone `go vet ./...` as a belt-and-suspenders guarantee is best practice. go vet is the canonical Go analysis pass and catches issues that some linter wrappers might miss or misconfigure.

## What to Do
- Add `go vet ./...` as a step in the lint job (or as a separate job)
- Should run before golangci-lint

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `go vet ./...` runs in CI
- [ ] Fails the build on any vet findings
- [ ] Currently passes cleanly

## Notes
- Low effort, low risk. Just an extra `run:` step.
- Some teams skip this since golangci-lint includes govet. Reasonable to deprioritize.
close_reason: Closed

title: Audit Terrakube API coverage gaps in Go client
description: Assess the full Terrakube API surface area against the current Go client library and identify which APIs are missing. The current client covers 22 resource services: Organizations, Workspaces, Modules, Teams, TeamTokens, Variables, OrganizationVariables, Templates, Tags, VCS, SSH, Agents, Collections, CollectionItems, CollectionReferences, WorkspaceTags, WorkspaceAccess, WorkspaceSchedules, Webhooks, WebhookEvents, History, and Jobs. This audit needs to discover all Terrakube REST API endpoints from their documentation/source code (https://github.com/AzBuilder/terrakube), catalog current coverage, and produce a gap analysis with priority recommendations for missing resources.
design: Approach: (1) Pull Terrakube API controller/route definitions from AzBuilder/terrakube GitHub repo to enumerate all REST endpoints. (2) Cross-reference against the 22 services in client.go. (3) Categorize gaps by resource type (CRUD operations, relationships, special endpoints). (4) Prioritize based on Terraform provider usage patterns and common automation needs.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Full list of Terrakube API endpoints documented (from Terrakube source/docs)
- [ ] Current Go client coverage mapped against API surface
- [ ] Gap analysis produced listing missing resources/endpoints
- [ ] Each gap prioritized (P0-P4) based on typical client usage
- [ ] Recommendations documented for implementation order
- [ ] Results captured in a bead or linked document for future implementation tracking
notes: Terrakube uses JSON:API spec. Source repo: https://github.com/AzBuilder/terrakube. The Go client uses google/jsonapi for serialization. Some endpoints (like TeamToken) use raw JSON instead of JSON:API format - watch for similar patterns in undiscovered endpoints.
close_reason: Killed by Dennis

title: Add APIVersion constant tracking Terrakube OpenAPI version
description: Add a const APIVersion = "2.27.0" to client.go so consumers can programmatically check which Terrakube API version the library targets. Update README to mention it.
design: Simple const declaration in client.go alongside other package-level constants/vars. No function needed — just a string constant. README mention should go in an "API Version" section or similar.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] APIVersion constant added to client.go with value "2.27.0"
- [ ] Constant is exported (uppercase APIVersion)
- [ ] README.md updated to mention APIVersion constant
- [ ] Existing tests still pass
close_reason: All quality gates passed: code, tests, docs, security

title: Add Dependabot config for Go modules
description:
## Context
Dependabot is configured for github-actions but NOT for gomod (Go modules). We currently have one direct dependency (google/jsonapi v1.0.0) but as dependencies grow, automated CVE/update PRs for go.mod are essential.

## What to Do
- Update `.github/dependabot.yml` to add a `gomod` package ecosystem entry
- Configure weekly schedule (matching the github-actions cadence)
- Target the main branch

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `.github/dependabot.yml` includes `package-ecosystem: gomod`
- [ ] Schedule set to weekly
- [ ] Directory set to `/`
- [ ] Dependabot creates PRs for Go module updates automatically

## Example Config Addition
```yaml
- package-ecosystem: gomod
  directory: /
  schedule:
    interval: weekly
```

## Reference
- https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/dependabot-version-updates/configuration-options-for-the-dependabot.yml-file
close_reason: Already implemented - dependabot.yml already has gomod ecosystem configured

title: Add crud_test assertion that nested services use filter[type] keys
description: Add a table-driven test in crud_test.go that iterates over all services initialized in NewClient and verifies: (1) nested services (those whose List takes parent IDs) have a non-empty filterKey set to filter[type], (2) top-level services (Organization, Action, GithubAppToken) use the default plain filter, (3) when ListOptions.Filter is set, the actual HTTP request query param key matches the service's filterKey exactly. This prevents future services from being added without the correct filterKey — the test fails automatically instead of requiring someone to remember.
close_reason: Added TestNewClient_FilterKeys (reflection-based exhaustive check of all service filterKeys) and TestCrudService_List_CustomFilterKey (HTTP-level verification that custom filterKey is used as query param)

title: terrakube-go v2: generics refactor + feature completeness
description: Rewrite terrakube-go using Go generics for the CRUD base layer, update all models to full field coverage from OpenAPI spec v2.27.0, and add 8 missing resource services. Target: 30 JSON:API resources + TeamToken custom endpoint.
close_reason: Epic complete: generics refactor + 8 new services + model updates + full test coverage

title: Implement generic CRUD base (crud.go)
description: Create crud.go with a generic crudService[T any] struct embedding *Client. Methods: list(), get(), create(), update(), del(). Handles JSON:API marshaling, filter params (filter[resourceType]), ID validation, error handling. This is the foundation everything else builds on. Must support ListOptions with filter param keyed by resource type name.
close_reason: crud.go implemented, build/lint/test pass

title: Add Implementation service + model
description: New resource. JSON:API type: implementation. Nested: /organization/{orgId}/provider/{providerId}/version/{versionId}/implementation. Fields: os, arch, filename, downloadUrl, shasumsUrl, shasumsSignatureUrl, shasum, keyId, asciiArmor, trustSignature, source, sourceUrl. Relation: version. Full CRUD. Also accessible flat at /implementation/{id}.
close_reason: Service files created with crudService[T] pattern

title: Add ModuleVersion service + model
description: New resource. JSON:API type: module_version. Nested: /organization/{orgId}/module/{moduleId}/version. Fields: version, commit. Relation: module. Full CRUD.
close_reason: Service files created with crudService[T] pattern

title: Add GithubAppToken service + model
description: New resource. JSON:API type: github_app_token. Flat endpoint: /github_app_token. Fields: appId, installationId, owner, token (secret) + audit fields. Full CRUD. Top-level resource, no parent ID.
close_reason: Service files created with crudService[T] pattern

title: Add Address service + model
description: New resource. JSON:API type: address. Nested under job. Fields: name, type (enum: AddressType) + audit fields. Relation: job. Also accessible via flat /address/{id}. Represents Terraform managed resource addresses in job output.
close_reason: Service files created with crudService[T] pattern

title: Update tests for all refactored and new services
description: Ensure all 30 resource services + TeamToken have passing tests. Update existing tests to work with refactored generics-based services. Add tests for 8 new resources. Verify CI passes (go test, golangci-lint).
close_reason: 128 new tests for 8 new services, all existing tests pass, 0 lint issues

title: Update CI and documentation for v2
description: Update README, ensure CI workflow passes with all new code. Verify golangci-lint clean. Update go.mod if needed. Tag as v2 or appropriate semver bump since the internal architecture changed (public API should remain compatible).
close_reason: README updated with 8 new resources, AGENTS.md updated with generics architecture, CI unchanged, all quality gates pass

title: Refactor OrganizationService as generics proof-of-concept
description: Refactor OrganizationService to embed crudService[Organization] and delegate CRUD to generic base. This validates the generics approach before touching all 20 other services. Existing tests must still pass.
close_reason: OrganizationService refactored to generics, all tests pass

title: Write comprehensive tests for generic CRUD base
description: Table-driven tests for crudService generic base: List (with/without filter), Get (valid/empty ID), Create, Update (valid/empty ID), Delete (valid/empty ID), HTTP error handling (4xx, 5xx). Use testutil mock server. These tests validate the core once so per-resource tests can be thin.
close_reason: 26 test cases covering all CRUD methods, all passing

title: Refactor remaining 20 existing services to use generic CRUD base
description: Refactor all existing services to embed crudService[T] and delegate to generic base. Services: Workspace, Module, Team, Variable, OrgVariable, Template, Tag, VCS, SSH, Agent, Collection, CollectionItem, CollectionReference, WorkspaceTag, WorkspaceAccess, WorkspaceSchedule, Webhook, WebhookEvent, History, Job. TeamToken stays custom (non-JSON:API). Each service becomes thin typed wrappers (~5-8 lines per method: validate IDs, build path, delegate). All existing tests must pass.
close_reason: All 20 services refactored to generics, models updated, all tests pass

title: Update all existing model structs with complete fields from OpenAPI spec
description:
Update model structs to match server OpenAPI spec v2.27.0 field coverage. Key gaps:

- Workspace: add locked, lockDescription, moduleSshKey, lastJobStatus, lastJobDate + audit fields + relations (agent, ssh, organization, etc.)
- Job: add approvalTeam, comments, commitId, overrideBranch, planChanges, refresh, refreshOnly, tcl, templateReference, terraformPlan, via + audit fields + relations (step, workspace, organization, address)
- Module: add downloadQuantity, latestVersion, registryPath + audit fields
- History: add serial, md5, lineage + audit fields
- Schedule: add description, enabled + audit fields  
- VCS: add callback, accessToken, redirectUrl + audit fields
- All other models: add createdBy, createdDate, updatedBy, updatedDate where supported by server

Use OpenAPI spec at ../terrakube/openapi-spec/v2_27_0.yml as source of truth for field names.
close_reason: All 20 services refactored to generics, models updated, all tests pass

title: Add Action service + model
description: New resource. JSON:API type: action. Flat endpoint: /action, /action/{id}. Fields: action (string), active (bool), category, description, displayCriteria, label, name, type, version + audit fields. No parent ID needed (top-level resource). Full CRUD.
close_reason: Service files created with crudService[T] pattern

title: Add Step service + model
description: New resource. JSON:API type: step. Nested under job. Endpoints via /organization/{orgId}/job/{jobId}/step. Fields: name, output, status, stepNumber. Relation: job. Also accessible via flat /step/{id} endpoint. CRUD operations.
close_reason: Service files created with crudService[T] pattern

title: Add Provider service + model
description: New resource. JSON:API type: provider. Nested under organization: /organization/{orgId}/provider. Fields: name, description. Relations: organization, version (hasMany). Full CRUD.

title: Add ProviderVersion service + model
description: New resource. JSON:API type: version (provider context). Nested: /organization/{orgId}/provider/{providerId}/version. Fields: versionNumber, protocols. Relations: provider, implementation (hasMany). Full CRUD.

title: Fix revive lint: Module.Ssh field should be SSH
description: module.go:17 has struct field Ssh which should be SSH per Go naming conventions. golangci-lint revive var-naming rule flags this.
close_reason: Fixed by foundation agent during Phase 3a refactoring

title: Add Go version matrix to CI
description:
## Context
CI currently tests only Go 1.24. Open source Go libraries should test against the two most recent Go releases to catch compatibility issues before users report them.

## What to Do
- Update `.github/workflows/ci.yml` to use a strategy matrix for the `test` and `build` jobs
- Test against Go 1.23 and 1.24 (the two most recent stable releases)
- Keep lint pinned to a single Go version (latest) since golangci-lint may not support older versions cleanly

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `test` job runs against Go 1.23 and 1.24
- [ ] `build` job runs against Go 1.23 and 1.24
- [ ] `lint` job remains on Go 1.24 only
- [ ] All matrix combinations pass CI
- [ ] Matrix is easy to update when Go 1.25 ships (just bump the list)

## Reference
- hashicorp/go-tfe tests 3 Go versions
- google/go-github tests 2 Go versions
close_reason: Closed

title: Plan for tracking and adapting to Terrakube API changes
description: OpenAPI spec tracking and sync system for terrakube-go. Automated diffing, coverage validation, and template-based code generation to keep Go client in sync with upstream Terrakube API. Design: docs/plans/openapi-tracking/ADR.md. Implementation: docs/plans/openapi-tracking/IMPLEMENTATION.md

title: Core validation library (internal/speccheck/)
description:
Build internal/speccheck/ package with 4 files:

**discovery.go** - Reflect Client struct -> service fields -> crudService[T] -> extract model type T -> parse jsonapi tags. Returns []ModelInfo{ServiceName, ResourceType, ModelType, FilterKey}. Skip TeamToken/Operations (no crudService embed).

**types.go** - Bidirectional Go <-> OpenAPI type mapping. string<->string, *string<->nullable string, bool<->boolean, int32<->integer/int32, int64<->integer/int64, float64<->number/double, *T->nullable. TypesCompatible() function for validation.

**validator.go** - ValidateModel(modelType, schema) compares struct fields with jsonapi attr tags against OpenAPI schema properties. Reports: MissingInStruct, MissingInSchema, type mismatches per field.

**paths.go** - Construct expected API paths from service info, validate against OpenAPI spec paths. Handle path variations: nested (/org/{id}/resource), flat (/resource), mixed (CollectionReference), no-org (WorkspaceSchedule).

Full unit tests for each file. Package: internal/speccheck. Dependencies: kin-openapi, reflect.

AC:
- [ ] DiscoverModels returns 29 models from real Client instance
- [ ] TeamToken and Operations are skipped
- [ ] All Go primitive types mapped correctly to OpenAPI types
- [ ] Validator detects missing fields in both directions
- [ ] Validator detects type mismatches
- [ ] Path validation handles all 5 path pattern variants
- [ ] >80% test coverage

title: CLI fetch + spec vendoring
description:
Build cmd/speccheck/ CLI scaffold and fetch subcommand.

**cmd/speccheck/main.go** - CLI entry point with subcommand routing (fetch, diff, check, sync). Standard flag package, no external CLI frameworks.

**cmd/speccheck/fetch.go** - Download OpenAPI spec from AzBuilder/terrakube GitHub repo via API.
- Flags: --version (default: latest), --output (default: openapi/v{VERSION}.json), --repo (default: AzBuilder/terrakube), --force
- Fetches from /repos/{owner}/{repo}/contents/openapi-spec/ via GitHub API
- Supports GITHUB_TOKEN env var for auth (warns about rate limits if unset)
- Validates downloaded JSON is parseable OpenAPI spec

**openapi/ directory** - Create with README.md documenting source URL and update process.
- Fetch and vendor v2.27.0 spec as initial baseline

Tests: fetch_test.go with network-gated integration test (skip if no GITHUB_TOKEN).

AC:
- [ ] speccheck fetch downloads spec from GitHub API
- [ ] speccheck fetch --version=v2.27.0 works
- [ ] openapi/v2.27.0.json is valid and vendored
- [ ] GITHUB_TOKEN auth works when set
- [ ] Rate limit warning when GITHUB_TOKEN unset
- [ ] openapi/README.md documents process

title: CLI diff + semver guidance
description:
Build diff subcommand with oasdiff integration and semver guidance.

**cmd/speccheck/diff.go** - Compare two vendored spec versions.
- Flags: --from (required), --to (required), --format (text|json, default: text), --breaking-only, --fail-on-breaking
- Uses oasdiff library to compute structured diff
- Categorizes: breaking (ERR), potentially breaking (WARN), non-breaking (INFO)
- Semver guidance output: ERR present -> MAJOR, new endpoints/properties -> MINOR, else -> PATCH
- Text output shows categorized changes with paths and details
- JSON output for machine processing
- Exit 1 with --fail-on-breaking if breaking changes found

Dependencies: github.com/oasdiff/oasdiff, github.com/getkin/kin-openapi

Tests: diff_test.go with two test specs containing known differences.

AC:
- [ ] speccheck diff --from=v2.27.0 --to=v2.27.0 shows no changes
- [ ] Breaking changes detected and categorized as ERR
- [ ] New endpoints detected and categorized as INFO
- [ ] Semver guidance output (MAJOR/MINOR/PATCH)
- [ ] --format=json produces valid JSON
- [ ] --fail-on-breaking exits 1 when breaking changes exist
- [ ] --breaking-only filters output

title: CLI check + CI integration test
description:
Build check subcommand and speccheck_test.go integration test.

**cmd/speccheck/check.go** - Validate Go structs against vendored spec.
- Flags: --version (default: APIVersion), --verbose, --json, --fail-on-missing
- Creates Client with dummy creds, runs DiscoverModels, ValidateModel for each, ValidatePaths
- Summary output: resources validated, fields valid, endpoints matched, issues found
- Verbose: per-field detail for each model
- JSON: structured report for processing
- Exit 0 if clean, exit 1 if issues

**speccheck_test.go** (repo root, package terrakube_test) - CI integration test.
- TestOpenAPIModelCoverage: loads vendored spec, discovers models, validates all fields
- TestOpenAPIPathCoverage: validates all endpoint paths
- Skips with t.Skip() if spec file not found (with helpful message)
- Runs automatically in existing go test ./... CI pipeline

AC:
- [ ] speccheck check validates all 29 models against vendored spec
- [ ] speccheck check --verbose shows per-field detail
- [ ] speccheck check --json outputs valid JSON report
- [ ] speccheck_test.go passes in CI
- [ ] speccheck_test.go skips gracefully when spec not vendored
- [ ] No changes needed to .github/workflows/ci.yml

title: Sync engine (template-based codegen)
description:
Build sync subcommand that auto-generates Go code from spec changes.

**cmd/speccheck/sync.go** - Template-based code generation leveraging crudService[T] pattern.
- Flags: --from (default: current APIVersion), --to (required), --dry-run, --verbose
- Pipeline: diff specs -> identify changes -> generate/modify Go code -> go fmt

**For new resources (new OpenAPI path not covered by existing service):**
1. Generate model struct from schema properties (Go types mapped from OpenAPI types, jsonapi tags)
2. Generate service type: type XService struct { crudService[X] }
3. Generate 5 CRUD methods with correct path construction and ID validation
4. Generate test file with standard CRUD test scaffolding
5. Add service field to Client struct in client.go
6. Add service init line in NewClient() in client.go
7. Derive filterKey from resource type convention

**For new fields on existing resources:**
- Insert new field into existing model struct with correct jsonapi tag and Go type

**For removed fields:**
- Flag with // DEPRECATED in vX.Y.Z comment, don't auto-delete

**For removed endpoints:**
- Print warning, don't auto-delete

**Updates APIVersion constant** in client.go to new version.
**Runs go fmt** on all generated/modified files.
**Prints summary** of all changes made.
**--dry-run** shows what would change without writing files.

Templates use text/template, not AST manipulation. The crudService[T] pattern is uniform enough that templates work cleanly.

AC:
- [ ] New resource generates: model struct, service type, CRUD methods, test file
- [ ] Generated code follows existing patterns exactly (passes golangci-lint)
- [ ] New fields added to existing structs with correct types and tags
- [ ] APIVersion constant updated
- [ ] client.go field and init line added for new services
- [ ] --dry-run shows changes without writing
- [ ] go fmt runs on all output
- [ ] Removed fields/endpoints flagged but not deleted

title: mise integration + documentation
description:
Wire up mise tasks and update documentation.

**.mise.toml** additions:
- spec-check: go run ./cmd/speccheck check --verbose
- spec-fetch: go run ./cmd/speccheck fetch
- spec-diff: go run ./cmd/speccheck diff --from=${FROM} --to=${TO}
- spec-sync: go run ./cmd/speccheck sync --to=${TO}

**README.md** - Add 'OpenAPI Spec Tracking' section:
- How to validate coverage (mise run spec-check)
- How to fetch latest spec (mise run spec-fetch)
- How to diff versions (mise run spec-diff)
- How to sync code (mise run spec-sync)
- Step-by-step: Updating for New Terrakube Versions

**go.mod** - Ensure kin-openapi and oasdiff dependencies are tidy.

End-to-end smoke test of full workflow:
1. mise run spec-fetch
2. mise run spec-check
3. mise run spec-diff (same version -> no changes)
4. mise run test (all pass)

AC:
- [ ] All 4 mise tasks work
- [ ] README documents the full workflow
- [ ] go mod tidy produces no changes
- [ ] End-to-end smoke test passes

title: Workspace and Module services missing filterKey
description: WorkspaceService and ModuleService in client.go are initialized without filterKey, so they default to plain 'filter' query param. The Terrakube API (Elide) ignores plain 'filter' on nested endpoints — it requires 'filter[workspace]' and 'filter[module]' (disjoint RSQL syntax). All other nested services already have the correct filterKey set. Fix: add filterKey to Workspace and Module service initialization in client.go.
close_reason: Fixed filterKey for all 8 missing nested services: Workspace, Module, Step, Provider, ProviderVersion, Implementation, ModuleVersion, Address. Updated corresponding tests.
